Bella and Ben stopped bouncing. They looked at their mom and felt very scared. They knew they had done something very bad. They wished they had eaten their broccoli. They wished they had listened to their mom. They wished they could bounce again. But it was too late. Their mom took away their beds and their trampoline and their sofa. She gave them only hard chairs to sit on. She said they had to eat broccoli every day. She said they had to learn their lesson.
Bella and Ben were very sad. They had no more fun. They had no more bouncing.

, and he hardly knew what was out there. But he was brave, and he decided to try to escape.
The rat quickly found out that escaping was not easy. Everywhere he went he came into difficult situations and had to use his wit and intelligence to get past them. He didn't give up, and eventually he was successful and found himself free in the outside world.
The moral of the story is that if you have courage and don't give up, even difficult situations can be overcome.

One day, a little boy named Tim saw an elderly lady. She was struggling to carry a big pie. Tim wanted to help her, but he was very small.
Tim thought hard. He knew he had to do something. He ran to a big tree and found a long stick. With the stick, he could help the elderly lady carry the pie.
Together, they carried the pie using the stick. It was not easy, but they did it. The elderly lady was so happy, she gave Tim a big piece of pie. They both smiled and enjoyed the yummy pie.

Once upon a time, there was a yellow cat named Sunny. Sunny had a label on her collar that said her name. She lived in a big house with her friend, a little girl named Lisa. They loved to play together every day.
One day, Sunny started to suffer from a bad tummy ache. She cried and cried, and Lisa heard her. Lisa asked, "Sunny, what's wrong?" Sunny could not tell her, but she kept crying. Lisa knew she had to help her friend.

not so bad.

Once upon a time there was a boy named John. John was an adventurous boy and he loved exploring the world. Every spring, he would borrow his father’s bike and go on a journey to discover new things. 
One spring morning, John was ready to leave on his adventure. But just as he was taking off, his father stopped him. 
“John, before you go, I have to borrow your bike”. said his father.
